President Trump claimed that when the Un: many other countries impose high tariffs and taxes. The expert's verdict states that this claim is misleading, as most tariffs with key trading partners like the European Union, Australia, and Canada are relatively low. The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) also ensures that the United States pays zero tariffs when trading with Canada.
The expert: s verdict suggests that while American producers may face higher taxes in certain markets, local producers in those markets also face similar taxes. This implies that the playing field is not entirely uneven, as both domestic and foreign producers may encounter tax burdens in different countries.
